intro: Dichaetanthera oblongifolia var. subrubra, commonly known as the red-stemmed dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
